column4: I've got a question about a Realtek 8139 ethernet card...nothing on the forums has helped
anyone have any experience with that?
do we know why?
good luck
that's an old card, yes, but not in ubuntu.  I have had it working in old linux boxes for ages, though.
exactly, exactly. It works on like Mandrake and Slackware but anything Debian has trouble with it (Knoppix, etc)
sorry, i don't.  I would have expected it to "just work".
yeah, me too...it's a shame because it's the only thing keeping me from installing Ubuntu on this computer...Windows has slowed to an unusable crawl
eh, thanks
just out of curiosity, and I don't think this will help, but have you tried manually configuring the IP / netmask / gateway, etc?
yeah, tried manual IP and stuff too

I hate to say this, because I *know* that linux *should* work well with the realtek card, but maybe at the end of the day it's not worth your time to continue to troubleshoot this card over say just running out and buying a different card.
indeed, indeed...I'd just _like_ it to work with this one
I hear ya

just on a hunch, I've been reading some of those links to forum articles and it looks like it may be some problem with a clashing PCI address.  IIRC, differetn addresses get assigned to different PCI slots so it's entirely possible that just moving the card to a different slot will fix the problem.
woah, that actually sounds like a brilliant idea
lemme do some tests here for amenado, then I'll try that
ok, and good luck
thanks!
thank me if it works ;-)
haha, welllll I just realized...it's hardwired to the MB...not gonna be able to move it anywhere :(
ahhh, oh well, look in the CMOS setup, though, it may have an option to change the address in there.
OK
did you try "/etc/init.d/networking restart" after you changed from roaming to dhcp?
